IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: DEDICATED TO PREVENTING AND combating CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT THROUGH THE PROVISON OF A VARIETY OF FAMILY FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SCAN-HARBOR, INC. WAS FORMED TO PREVENT AND COMBAT CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT IN THE EAST HARLEM AND THE SOUTH BRONX COMMUNITIES OF NEW YORK CITY. THE ORGANIZATION CONTINUES TO PROVIDE EXTENSIVE CULTURALLY SENSITIVE SERVICES FOR THE CHILDREN, YOUTH, AND FAMILIES OF THESE NEIGHBORHOODS. THE ORGANIZATION'S SERVICES ARE FAMILY-FOCUSED AND ASSET-BASED AND ARE DELIVERED BY A SKILLED BI-LINGUAL STAFF. IN ORDER TO SUPPORT FAMILIES IN CRISIS, THE ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAMS PROVIDE: A) PREVENTIVE AND INTENSIVE PREVENTIVE INDIVIDUAL, FAMILY AND GROUP COUNSELING AND PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOTHERAPY FOCUSED ON DOMESTIC ISSUES, SUBSTANCE ABUSE, AIDS, AND POST-TRAUMATIC STRESS DISORDERS. B) COMMUNITY AND SCHOOL BASED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR CHILDREN, PARENTS AND FAMILIES FOCUSED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SOCIALIZATION SKILLS, CREATIVE AND CULTURAL ARTS, RECREATION, COLLEGE PREPARATION AND EMPLOYMENT SKILLS. C) ADVOCACY, INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES (CURRENTLY INCLUDING LEGAL AND FINANCIAL ADVICE AND SUPPOR
IRS990.Desc: YOUTH SERVICES - THE ORGANIZATION AFTER-SCHOOL-TIME and summer PROGRAMMING INCLUDES SERVICES AT 18 SCHOOLS AND 9 CENTER BASED PROGRAMS IN THE BRONX AND MANHATTAN SERVING OVER 6,065 YOUNG PEOPLE. SERVICES INCLUDE ACTIVITIES THAT BUILD SKILLS, EXPAND TO RESERVE OF KNOWLEDGE FOR EACH PARTICIPANT, PROMOTE HEALTH AND FITNESS AND SUPPORT LIFE-LONG LEARNING. THESE PROGRAMS ARE SUPPORTED BY FUNDING FROM NYC DEPARTMENT OF YOUTH AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT (AFTER SCHOOL, BEACON, CORNERSTONE); AND Empire after school (ESDSVP).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FAMILY PREVENTIVE SERVICES - THE ORGANIZATION'S ADMINISTRATION FOR CHILDREN'S SERVICES FUNDED PREVENTIVE SERVICES PROGRAM PROVIDED FAMILY PRESERVATION SERVICES TO PREVENT ABUSE AND NEGLECT. WORKING WITH 128 clients THE ORGANIZATION PROGRAMS ASSERTED FOSTER CARE PLACEMENTS AND RESTORED FAMILY STABILITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES - THE ORGANIZATION'S OASAS FUNDED PREVENTION PROGRAMMING CONSISTS OF A COMBINATION OF EDUCATION, COUNSELING, AND POSITIVE ALTERNATIVES THAT PROVIDES STUDENTS FROM MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL WITH ESSENTIAL FACTS ABOUT THE CONSEQUENCES OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND GAMBLING AND DYNAMICALLY STRENGTHENS STUDENTS' PRO-SOCIAL ATTITUDES THAT INCREASE THEIR RESILIENCE. THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN PROVIDING EVIDENCE-BASED PREVENTION SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH. IT CONTINUES TO PROVIDE EFFECTIVE PREVENTION SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES THAT FOSTER POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND DISCOURAGES THE DEVELOPMENT OF DRUG AND ALCOHOL USE, GAMBLING, AND OTHER RISK BEHAVIORS. THE MAJORITY OF THESE STUDENTS LIVE IN THE LOW-INCOME/HIGH-RISK NEIGHBORHOODS OF EAST AND WEST/CENTRAL HARLEM AND THE SOUTH BRONX. THE PROGRAM SERVICED 135 CLIENTS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR. FEE FOR SERVICES' USDC PROGRAM PROVIDES OUTPATIENT MEDICALLY SUPERVISED PROGRAM THROUGH TELEMEDICINE/INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP COUNSELING DURING COVID 19 CRISIS, ON-SITE SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH TESTING AND TREATMENT SERVICES, AND INDIVIDUAL, GROUP, FAMILY COUNSELING, MENTAL HEALTH ASSESSMENT, PSYCHOLOGICAL EVALUATION AND URINE SCREENING. FEE FOR SERVICES' MAKING CHOICES PROGRAM MEDICALLY SUPERVISES OUTPATIENT NON-FUNDED PROGRAM. SERVICES COMPRISE OF OUTPATIENT DRUG TREATMENT & MENTAL HEALTH SCREENING. THE PROGRAM CATERS TO INDIVIDUAL, GROUP AND FAMILY COUNSELING, URINE SCREENING. FEES ARE COLLECTED THROUGH MANAGED CARE REIMBURSEMENT AND MEDICAID REIMBURSEMENT. USDC AND MAKING CHOICES PROGRAMS SERVICE 98 CLIENTS DURING THE FISCAL YEAR.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: NYS DEPT OF HEALTH - HEALTH AND FOOD

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO EAST HARLEM ARTS & ED

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCAN-HARBOR, INC. HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT AND SPENDING POLICIES, AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, FOR ENDOWMENT ASSETS THAT ATTEMPT TO PROVIDE A STREAM OF RETURNS THAT WOULD BE UTILIZED TO FUND VARIOUS PROGRAMS WHILE SEEKING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.

Under U.S. GAAP, SCAN-Harbor must recognize the financial statement effects of a tax position taken for tax return purposes when it is more likely than not that the position will not be sustained upon examination by a taxing authority. SCAN-Harbor does not believe it has taken any material uncertain tax positions and, accordingly, it has not recorded any liability for unrecognized tax benefits. SCAN-Harbor has filed for and received income tax exemptions in the jurisdictions where it is required to do so. additionally, SCAN-Harbor has filed IRS Form 990 information returns, as required, and all other applicable returns in jurisdictions where so required. SCAN-Harbor is subject to routine audits by a taxing authority. As of June 30, 2022, SCAN-Harbor was not subject to any examination by a taxing authority.
PAYMENTS ARE CLOSELY REVIEWED AND MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

Bonuses were paid based on the performance of the individuals and within the approved budget. Bonuses were taxable and reported on the individuals' 2021 form w-2s, and included on schedule j, part ii in column b (ii).
THE NUMERICAL DATA IN COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY A NATIONAL ACCOUNTING FIRM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL DEPARTMENT. THE FISCAL DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD REVIEW FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE ORGANIZATION'S BUSINESS ETHICS POLICY. WHEN A POTENTIAL CONFLICT EXISTS, IT MUST BE PROPERLY DISCLOSED AND AN APPROPRIATE DETERMINATION MADE BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. PROPERLY DISCLOSED AND AN APPROPRIATE DETERMINATION MADE BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 15A AND 15B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE SALARY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND FISCAL DIRECTORS. THE SALARIES FOR EACH POSITION ARE COMPARED WITH SALARY SURVEYS OF THE UNITED NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSES AND THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILDCARE AGENCIES. BOTH, THE UNITED NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSES AND THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILDCARE AGENCIES' SALARY SURVEYS ARE ORGANIZED IN REGARD TO THE SIZE/FUNDING OF COMPARABLE SIZED/FUNDED AGENCIES (E.G. ANNUAL BUDGETS $10,000,000 OR $20,000,000, ETC.). THE ORGANIZATION COMPARES THE SALARIES OF THE EXECUTIVE AND FISCAL DIRECTORS WITH COMPARABLE SIZED AGENCIES. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR RECOMMENDS SALARIES FOR ALL ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THESE RECOMMENDATIONS ARE BASED ON THE EMPLOYEES' PERFORMANCE, AGENCY FISCAL STATUS, AND COMPARABLE ASSESSMENTS PROVIDED THROUGH THE UNITED NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSES AND THE COUNCIL OF FAMILY AND CHILDCARE AGENCIES. THE FISCAL COMMITTEE SIMILARLY REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY AND FORWARDS ITS RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
